sentences: T nad tapavad need kaks lindu.
context: 'Tapame' is the 1st person plural (me/we) present indicative form of the verb 'tappama', which means 'to kill'. It specifically refers to the action of killing in a general sense. The word can be used for both literal killing and metaphorical contexts, though it's most commonly associated with taking life. When conjugated, 'tappama' becomes 'tapame' for we/me in present tense.
